chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Int. Cause Bodily Harm/Cause Great Bodily Harm
Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Int. Cause Bodily Harm/Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Ryan Gregory Lewis was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

records.addlTxt: Order for Placement
Clerk emailed Order to court info at GCSD

2:52 PM Defendant Ryan Gregory Lewis in court, in custody.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Ryan Gregory Lewis.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Ryan Gregory Lewis.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. State complied with Victim Witness Notification. Amended Information filed. Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. NGI plea on Count 1. Defendant advised of U.S. non-citizen collateral consequences resulting in deportation, the exclusion of admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law. Defendant advised of firearm restriction. Defendant advised of voting rights. The Court accepts the reports from the doctors as a part of the decision making. It is the Courts intent to follow the recommendations of both parties. The Court adopts the recommendation and finds the defendant is not guilty due to mental disease or defect on count 1. Count 2 to be dismissed and read in. The Court commits the defendant to the Department of Health Services for not more than 20 years. The Defendant may petition the court after 6 months. Defendant has 197 days of credit. Defendant advised of post conviction relief. The Court signs the order for commitment.
Order for Committment

2:46 PM Defendant Ryan Gregory Lewis in court, in custody.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Ryan Gregory Lewis.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Ryan Gregory Lewis.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Sargent Taylor Heiman sworn in on oath to testify. Sargent Heiman identified the defendant. Sargent Heiman excused from the stand. State moves for the matter to be bound over for trial. Atty Smith states that DA Nolen has not found probable cause on who committed the crime. Court finds probable cause. Defendant bound over for trial. The defendant stands mute, not guilty pleas entered on the defendants behalf. Bond continued. Matter set over.

Violation - 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide; Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Int. Cause Bodily Harm/Cause Great Bodily.  Issuing Agency - Monroe PD.
NO CONTACT WITH: K.L. or her residence. The defendant may have contact with K.L through telephonic communication as well as jail visits.  May go to the residence one time to pick up personal belongings if accompanied by an officer. May not leave state of Wisconsin without permission of Court.  May not possess any knives or dangerous weapons except kitchen cutlery.

11:01 AM Defendant Ryan Gregory Lewis in court, in custody.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Ryan Gregory Lewis.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Krueger requests the court to order for competency. DA Nolen seconds the request from Atty Krueger. The Court makes the finding of probable cause to proceed with a competency evaluation. The Court orders an outpatient competency evaluation. DA request the bond to be amended to allow telephonic communication with the victim as well as jail visits. The Court amends the bond.
Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
